text: Horace L. Calvo January 4, 1927 - June 3, 1991) was an American politician and jurist. Born in Chicago, Illinois, Calvo went to Springfield Community College, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, and Saint Louis University School of Law. Calvo was admitted to the Illinois bar even though he never had a law degree. He served in the United States Air Force from 1944 to 1947. Calvo practiced law in Granite City, Illinois. He was an Illinois assistant attorney general from 1961 to 1968. From 1979 until 1975, Calvo served in the Illinois House of Representatives and was a Democrat. In 1975, Calvo was appointed Illinois Circuit Court judge and then was appointed to the Illinois Appellate Court in 1987. From 1989 until his death in 1991, Calvo served on the Illinois Supreme Court. Calvo died of cancer in a hospital in Saint Louis, Missouri.Illinois Supreme Court-Horace L. Calvo'Illinois Blue Book 1973-1974,' Biographical Sketch of Horace L. Calvo, pg. 166'State High Court Justice Horace Calvo,' Chicago Tribune, William Grady, June 4, 1991'Judge Has No Law Degree But Party's Nod For Supreme Court,' AP NEWS, Dennis Conrad, March 18, 1988 ==Notes== Category:1927 births Category:1991 deaths Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:People from Granite City, Illinois Category:Military personnel from Illinois Category:University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign alumni Category:Saint Louis University School of Law alumni Category:Illinois Democrats Category:Illinois state court judges Category:Judges of the Illinois Appellate Court Category:Justices of the Illinois Supreme Court Category:Members of the Illinois House of Representatives Category:Deaths from cancer in Missouri Category:20th-century American judges
title: Horace L. Calvo
